summary: HCMV infection induces the expression of type I interferon and a set of interferon-stimulated genes early upon infection. however, HCMV encodes multiple proteins, including IE1 (4–6), IE2 (7–9), pp65 (10, 11), and TRS1 and IRS1 (12, 13) HCMV has developed mechanisms for combating the host antiviral response but also to exploit antiviral molecules for its own benefit. the majority of the viruses restricted by IFITMs are enveloped RNA viruses whose entry is mediated through clathrin-mediated endocytosis (18). however, the precise mechanism that allows IFITMs to inhibit virus replication remains elusive. IFITMs may interfere with a membrane fusion step of virus entry either at the cell surface or in the endosome/lysosome compartments. a recent study reports that IFITM protein overexpression fails to inhibit the entry of three DNA viruses. but detailed mechanistic investigations have not been performed.
